Because his ult requires a knock up to actually use.

Let's see what does Yasuo's ult offer:

+Long range gap closer
+High AoE damage
+Potentially AoE hard CC
+Huge, long duration penetration boost
+No cost, extremely low cool down
+A shield

-Sometimes he has to hit a skillshot to use it provided none of your teammates lands their knockup.

And be honest here, it's more likely than not that you have 2-3 knock ups on your team. I understand Riot wanted for him to have it available every fight provided he meets the restriction, but seeing how everyone and their mother gets a knock up lately that "restriction" means shit once teamfights break.

My suggestions are to either:
-Massively increase his ultimate CD if he triggers it on someone else's knock up. This way he actually needs to hit a skillshot to have his nukesteroidgapclosershield on an absurdly low CD.
-Massively decrease the range if he triggers it on someone else. Meaning he can't jump on your squishy from 1000 range because one of 3 knock ups in your team landed on someone.
-Only allow it on true knock ups(no displacements or pulls). This reduces amount of champs he can (ab)use.

Note how his own Q trigger is unchanged. But look at popular picks: Your support is likely to be Janna, Thresh or Braum, maybe Nami. Your junglier is highly possible to be Lee, Vi or Jarvan. Your mid has a very high chance of being Fizz, Syndra or Orianna. Hell, even their latest ADC has a knock up.
HIs ult needs serious nerf in ability to trigger it of someone else, period.

>-Only allow it on true knock ups(no displacements or pulls). This reduces amount of champs he can (ab)use.

Only change you suggested that I can agree with.
Considering how hard he's been nerfed since release, he doesn't need any more "serious" nerfs.
